intro: Pterocarya × rehderiana, commonly known as the Chinese wingnut, is a hybrid species native to China. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive winged seeds. The plant belongs to the Juglandaceae family, which includes walnuts and hickories. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it produces large, showy male catkins. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
